#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <ctype.h>

int main() {
    // Read first three words
    char line1[1000], line2[1000], line3[1000];
    fgets(line1, sizeof(line1), stdin);
    fgets(line2, sizeof(line2), stdin);
    fgets(line3, sizeof(line3), stdin);

    // Process each to cleaned strings (remove non-letters, lowercase)
    char cleaned1[1000], cleaned2[1000], cleaned3[1000];
    int i, j;

    // Process line1 to cleaned1
    j = 0;
    for (i = 0; line1[i] != '\0'; i++) {
        if (isalpha(line1[i])) {
            cleaned1[j++] = tolower(line1[i]);
        }
    }
    cleaned1[j] = '\0';

    // Similarly for line2 and line3
    j = 0;
    for (i = 0; line2[i] != '\0'; i++) {
        if (isalpha(line2[i])) {
            cleaned2[j++] = tolower(line2[i]);
        }
    }
    cleaned2[j] = '\0';

    j = 0;
    for (i = 0; line3[i] != '\0'; i++) {
        if (isalpha(line3[i])) {
            cleaned3[j++] = tolower(line3[i]);
        }
    }
    cleaned3[j] = '\0';

    // Generate permutations
    // Need to create 6 permutations as strings.

    // Create an array to hold all permutations
    char *permutations[6];
    int perm_len = strlen(cleaned1) + strlen(cleaned2) + strlen(cleaned3);
    // Allocate memory for each permutation. Since all permutations have the same length, we can precompute.

    // permutation 1: cleaned1 + cleaned2 + cleaned3
    permutations[0] = (char*)malloc(perm_len + 1);
    strcpy(permutations[0], cleaned1);
    strcat(permutations[0], cleaned2);
    strcat(permutations[0], cleaned3);

    // permutation 2: cleaned1 + cleaned3 + cleaned2
    permutations[1] = (char*)malloc(perm_len + 1);
    strcpy(permutations[1], cleaned1);
    strcat(permutations[1], cleaned3);
    strcat(permutations[1], cleaned2);

    // permutation3: cleaned2 + cleaned1 + cleaned3
    permutations[2] = (char*)malloc(perm_len + 1);
    strcpy(permutations[2], cleaned2);
    strcat(permutations[2], cleaned1);
    strcat(permutations[2], cleaned3);

    // permutation4: cleaned2 + cleaned3 + cleaned1
    permutations[3] = (char*)malloc(perm_len + 1);
    strcpy(permutations[3], cleaned2);
    strcat(permutations[3], cleaned3);
    strcat(permutations[3], cleaned1);

    // permutation5: cleaned3 + cleaned2 + cleaned1
    permutations[4] = (char*)malloc(perm_len + 1);
    strcpy(permutations[4], cleaned3);
    strcat(permutations[4], cleaned2);
    strcat(permutations[4], cleaned1);

    // permutation6: cleaned3 + cleaned1 + cleaned2
    permutations[5] = (char*)malloc(perm_len + 1);
    strcpy(permutations[5], cleaned3);
    strcat(permutations[5], cleaned1);
    strcat(permutations[5], cleaned2);

    // Now read N
    int students;
    scanf("%d", &students);
    // consume the newline after %d
    getchar();

    // Prepare the output string (ACC/WA concatenated)
    char output_str[students * 4 + 1]; // Each test case can be up to 3 or 2 chars, but 4 is safe
    int out_len = 0;

    for (int i = 0; i < students; i++) {
        char test_line[1000];
        fgets(test_line, sizeof(test_line), stdin);

        // Process test_line into cleaned_test
        char cleaned_test[1000];
        j = 0;
        for (int k = 0; test_line[k] != '\0'; k++) {
            if (isalpha(test_line[k])) {
                cleaned_test[j++] = tolower(test_line[k]);
            }
        }
        cleaned_test[j] = '\0';

        // Check if cleaned_test matches any permutation
        int match = 0;
        for (int p = 0; p < 6; p++) {
            if (strcmp(cleaned_test, permutations[p]) == 0) {
                match = 1;
                break;
            }
        }

        // Append "ACC" or "WA" to output_str
        if (match) {
            strcat(output_str + out_len, "ACC");
            out_len += 3;
        } else {
            strcat(output_str + out_len, "WA");
            out_len += 2;
        }
    }

    // Now process the output_str through the second part's logic.

    // Count character frequencies
    int count[256] = {0};
    for (int i = 0; i < out_len; i++) {
        char c = output_str[i];
        count[c]++;
    }

    // Check conditions
    int distinct = 0;
    int valid = 1;
    for (int i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
        if (count[i] > 0) {
            distinct++;
            if (count[i] != 2) {
                valid = 0;
            }
        }
    }

    if (distinct == 2 && valid) {
        printf("Yes\n");
    } else {
        printf("No\n");
    }

    // Free allocated memory for permutations
    for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++) {
        free(permutations[i]);
    }

    return 0;
}
